claims.object: common interface that is used to allow communication between different peripheral devices like mice, digital cameras, printers, keyboards, media devices, scanners, flash drives & external hard drives as well as a host controller like a smartphone or PC

surface_layer.definition: A common interface used to allow communication between different peripheral devices and a host controller.

deep_layer.mechanism: Utilizes differential pair signals (D+ and D- lines) at 3.3V for data transmission to minimize electromagnetic interference.
deep_layer.origin: Part of the broader USB standard developed by Ajay V. Bhatt from Intel in 1996.

citations: USB Protocol : Architecture, Working Specifications ... How USB Works: Introduction (Part 1) - CircuitBread
